subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unable to accumulate failures within  a testcase
msgSnippet: Shane I am doing  using JUNIT for Integration testing  of SDK APIs at the moment.I found your code pretty useful as I can now build a small meaningful sequence
messageBody:
Shane
I am doing using JUNIT for Integration testing of
SDK APIs at the moment.I found your code pretty useful
as I can now build a small meaningful sequence of
tests within a Single TestCase
Thanks Much!
-Vidya
--- Shane Celis <shane@...> wrote:
> I had this problem as well, but found it necessary
> to change JUnit's
> behavior in order to do my integration testing
> (which is very different
> from unit testing and I wouldn't suggest it for unit
> testing). Anyway,
> if you find that you truly need this behavior the
> source and jar are
> available here:
>
> http://gnufoo.org/junit/index.html#failures
>
> -shane
>
> On Monday, January 7, 2002, at 07:30 AM, vidya_srn
> wrote:
>
> > Got it . thanks !
> > --- In junit@y..., Hammonds Nicholas
> <nicholas.hammonds@s...> wrote:
> >> Junit is behaving correctly in this case, the
> rule is: As soon as
> > assertTrue
> >> statement fails the fail is reported and that
> particular test is
> > aborted.
> >>
> >> You will need to use seperate tests if you want
> to evaluate
> > different
> >> assertTrue statments individualy.
> >>
> >> -----Original Message-----
> >> From: vidya_srn [mailto:vidya_srn@y...]
> >> Sent: Montag, 07. Janner 2002 16:15
> >> To: junit@y...
> >> Subject: [junit] Unable to accumulate failures
> within a testcase
> >>
> >>
> >> Hi
> >> I have just started using Junit
> >> I have a test case with multiple asserts .
> >> The testcase run always stops on the first
> failure.
> >> For ex in the TestCase I am running if I have,
> >>
> >> assertTrue( "test assert1" , 1==2);
> >> assertTrue( "test assert2" , 1==3);
> >>
> >> The run stops after logging the first failure.
> >> How do i accumulate all the failures within the
> testcase?
> >>
> >> Thanks
> >> Vidya
